alert.note: Alert for Lower Yukon Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 22 at 2:58PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding due to water over riverbanks continues to be possible. * WHERE...Along the Innoko River from Shageluk to 20 miles upstream. * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...The previous ice jam upriver from Grayling has caused a significant amount of water to flow over the banks of the Yukon River and into the Innoko River. Expect river levels on the Innoko to continue to be high, though water levels should begin to recede over the next couple of days as the dammed up water upstream on the Yukon flows downstream. Expect high water along the Yukon River from Grayling downstream over the next day or two, but no flooding is expected at this time on the Yukon River.
info.instruction: Residents are encouraged to monitor water levels along these areas of the Innoko River, and move items near the riverbank to higher ground.
